sentences.sContent: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
sentences.sCn: 许多国家，例如墨西哥和日本，经常发生地震。

sentences.sContent: ...he presents as an example the failure of the George W. Bush administration to prepare prop-erly for the after-effects of the invasion of iraq...
...it is wise for the parents to set an example rather than make demands...
...Kodak is an example of a firm that was very much aware that they had to adapt...
...Half a century later GM is a typical example of poor management...
...It is the most prominent example of a huge new "sharing economy"...
...The sharing economy is the latest example of the internet's value to consumers...
...Dale’s assumptions are another example of the well-intentioned but incorrect thinking that limits an organization’s ability to tap into the full potential of a diverse workforce...
...is an example of the unconverted consumer...

trans.tranOther: a specific fact, idea, person, or thing that is used to explain or support a general idea, or to show what is typical of a larger group
